name: Scottsdale Marriott Suites Old Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based once again on fellow TripAdvisor reviewers, we booked & stayed at this hotel for 2 nites. Certainly for a 'downtown' hotel, it's excellent value for money (we booked through Orbitz) & paid $129 / nite for a 1 rm 'suite' that is 'advertised' as $500 inside our room.
reviews.title: Luxurious beds! Ex value for $$

likes.liked: — Comfy beds & linens, proximity to shopping & restaurants
likes.disliked: — Noisy fellow guests & lack of gardens

reviews.text: The hotel staff are very friendly & very helpful. The hotel is very central to old downtown & within walking & trolley-ride distance of wonderful dining & shopping. The best part of this hotel IMO, are the spacious rooms & the beds. Their beds are some of the best we've ever slept on in a hotel. Very, very sumptious, very comfortable & with exceptionally nice linens. The rooms are well appointed & clean. The fridge is a plus as are 2 TVs & a separate shower & bathtub. The business centre provides free Internet access without having to pay for it in your room if you just need it for short periods. The pool is small & we did miss having gardens to sit out & relax in but that didn't detract too much from our stay.
reviews.title: great location for something to do at night
Excellent value; convenient; great food!
reviews.text: As we live in a rural area where it's very quiet & we seek out quiet hotels & resorts, we found staying at a downtown hotel somewhat noisy because of the sound of sirens & traffic although it's definitely NOT New York noisy. But the worst offenders are fellow inconsiderate hotel guests who don't bother to whisper in the halls at 3 am or who cause a ruckus at the pool at 1 am despite signs asking for quiet. This isn't the hotel's fault. But we're not used to this after staying at some very nice, quiet resorts in Arizona.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But, this is a GREAT hotel for the location, quality, price & value & wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others. We really did enjoy our brief stay here in a downtown area.
reviews.title: Location

reviews.text: The location of this hotel makes it great for lone business travel. It's located in the older section of town but right off a main street with bustling night life. Multiple bar/restaurants.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A clean well run hotel, with large rooms and a balcony and Staff were friendly. Big plus with scottsdale marriott suites is its location, easy and safe walk to old town with plenty of restaurants, also fifth avenue shops and scottsdale fashion mall.
reviews.title: great hotel if you dont have a car

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you dont want to walk then the scottsdale trolley stops about a block away and connects all the above every 10 minutes from 11am till 9pm 7 days a week and is free.For convenience and location you cant beat this hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect location and excellent value

reviews.text: Upscale stay at economy price. This hotel offers an amazing value, located in the Old Town section with easy and safe walking to art galleries, shops and restaurants. While most of Scottsdale is busy roads surrounding gated communities and golf courses, this location actually supports walking.
reviews.title: Convenient and worth a visit
Excellent Location
reviews.text: The hotel itself is sparkling clean with excellent staff service. The suite is large and well furnished. The bed is the best we have ever had and the views from the balcony are beautiful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked this so much we stayed at both ends of a 10 day Arizona road trip and would recommend it for either a short stay or an extended visit.
reviews.title: Great Location!

likes.disliked: — The small area in the bathroom

reviews.text: This Marriott is located in an ideal location in Scottsdale within walking distance to restaurants, bars, clubs and shops. The entry and lobby area is very comfortable, classy and pleasant. The front desk staff is very friendly, helpful and accomodating. Parking is underground and free. Pool is exceptionally clean and comfortable, although the structure of the hotel in addition to some trees allows for minimal sunlight during the winter months in the pool area.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The suites are large and well laid out. The beds are comfortable and the linens are plush and new. The decor itself in the rooms is very outdated, bruised and used. The wallpaper is peeling the bathrooms are beginning to appear outdated and the furnishings generally look worn and dated. Large, bulky televisions in the bedroom and living room. The rooms simply need a full makeover. Then the hotel would be fabulous.
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.liked: — Ground floor suite with private pool access

reviews.text: This hotel is ideally located for downtown Scottsdale and lots of restaurants, bars and craft shops are within easy walking distance. The Fashion Malls are a short drive away. The Suites are well equipped and freshly decorated. Although the pool is small and shallow there are plenty of cushioned sunloungers around and of course - a Marriott speciality - the hot tub. Excellent bar and restaurant in-house with very good service. Friendly and efficient reception staff make this hotel well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Convenient and comfortable

reviews.text: I stayed three nights on a business trip and found this a very comfortable hotel. I especially like the floor plan of the suite, which allowed two of us to get ready at the same time without getting in each other's way.
reviews.title: Loved the Stay!

likes.liked: — Freindly staff, location, and the beds!
likes.disliked: — You have to pay for internet

reviews.text: The bed is wonderfully comfortable (some sort of downy pillow-top mattress). The rooms would benefit from stronger lighting as it was difficult to read in both the sitting room and the bedroom.
reviews.title: Great Location, Very Good Hotel for the Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rate on the back of the suite door said $500 per night and we got it for less than half that through Expedia. We stayed two nights before our flight back to the UK.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.text: Our suite consisted of a lounge area with mini kitchen, a bedroom, jacuzzi bath and shower room with wc.
reviews.title: LOVED this hotel

reviews.text: The lounge area had a sofa, one armchair, a desk with internet access, large tv and patio doors opening onto a tiny balcony. The other end housed a mini kitchen with small fridge, sink and coffee maker.
reviews.title: Good hotel; awesome location

likes.disliked: — Wifi and the breakfast buffet are VERY expensive.

reviews.text: The bedroom had a king bed with lots of pillows and was very comfortable. There was also a further tv.
reviews.title: Good Value - Great Location

likes.liked: — The location and the room size

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The swimming pool was not large, but there were never many people there at one time and there were ample beds, chairs, shades and pool towels. Guest coin operated laundry machines were also in the pool area.
reviews.title: great location!

likes.disliked: — bathroom was dated, lighting, wallpaper needs to change.

aka: Scottsdale Marriott Suites Old Town Hotel
